headline: Top Korean tech company, but dubious attitude towards employees
pros: It is one of the top tech company that runs no.1 search portal in Korea. Not only does it have leading technology on search engine, but it also excels at AI speakers, speech recognition, translation, content recommendation and such.
cons: It does have the best (highly opinionated) cafeteria inside the building, but that's all its got for employee welfare. It pays below-average salary among other tech companies, and seems to be cutting back on profit sharing and incentives. It also discourages developers suggesting new ideas.

headline: Culture Review
pros: NAVER is a very innovative company growing and adopting many good aspects of  startups, such as flat organizational structure, fast decision-making, and clear ownership of products by product owners.
cons: It is small relative to great companies like Google, Facebook, Amazon, and Microsoft. Also, it is mainly located in Seoul, Korea and does not have major offices in the U.S or North American territory yet.

headline: Great company for software engineer and women

Naver is a leading internet portal service company in Korea.
Benefits and salary are quite good.  You can work with great colleagues.

Some projects are too tough to keep work and life balance.  It depends on a team where you're in.
There is no objective standard to review your performance.

headline: Intern

cons: There was no cohesive direction.

headline: Good working environment

headline: As a Senior Software Developer
pros: Naver is korean google. It's market share in internet advertising is over 70% in Korea, and it's Line messenger is becoming a new cash cow. Naver has a lot of products and you can find all kind of positions here. Naver is one of the best companies in software industry.  All of the Software developers hope to work here. you can control your work hours as you like as long as you show your productivity. Naver used be a just a local internet company but it is trying to be a globally competitive company.
cons: It shares most of the problems of Korean companies like authoritarianism, politics, long working hours, lack of communication. But most Koreans should be able to overcome them.

headline: Good welfare, working environment!
pros: It is a well known that salary, welfare, working environment is excellent in Korea. especially the building called 'Factory' is awesome. and their health insurance cover whole your family.
cons: Unfortunately, It also famous for crazy working time and Politics. Naver is the most powerful Internet company in Korea. but I think their growth potential is negative.
